metadata.Title: CVE-2021-32555 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
It was discovered that read_file() in apport/hookutils.py would follow symbolic links or open FIFOs. When this function is used by the xorg-hwe-18.04 package apport hooks, it could expose private data to other local users.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32555` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-gtk - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-kde - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-noui - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-retrace - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
apport-valgrind - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
dh-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
python-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
python-problem-report - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
python3-apport - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
python3-problem-report - 2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.9-0ubuntu7.24').
